p: The yield and chemical composition of oils from three Pinus spp. are presented in Table 1. In total, 58 compounds of the EOs were characterized from P. mugo needles, twigs and cones, representing 97.2, 96.1 and 72.1% of the total identified components, respectively. The main components detected in needles, twigs and cones oils are: δ-3-carene (19.3, 28.1 and 15.8%); α-pinene (21.3, 8.2 and 4.1%); ( E)-caryophyllene (6.7, 4.1 and 20.2%); limonene (3.7, 19.5 and 2.2%); β-pinene (3.7, 11 and 1.6%), linalool-acetate (0.1, 7.2 and 1.2%), germacrene D (6.1, 0.4 and 1.2%), linalool (0.2, 0.1 and 4.6%).
